000093421-d-08-27-11-CSX.Accident Cause: Other miscellaneous causes (Provide detailed description in narrative)
000093421-d-08-27-11-CSX.Narrative: CSX EMPLOYEE WAS FLAGGING FOR PROGRESS RAIL EMPLOYEES WHO WERE OPERATING A GRAPPLE TRUCK PICKING UPSCRAP RAIL. THE C4 RAIL TEAM HAD JUST LAID NEW CURVE PATCH RAIL AT THIS LOCATION. CSX FOREMAN STARTED WORK WITH PROGRESS RAIL AT BLAINE, WV WHERE HE CONDUCTED A JOB BRIEFING WITH THE PROGRESS RAIL TEAM. DURING THE BRIEFING IT WAS DISCUSSED THAT THEY WOULD GET OFF THE RAIL AS SOON AS POSSIBLE IF IT STARTED TO RAIN BECAUSE OF THE GRADE OF THE RAIL. THE PROGRESS RAIL TEAM HAD BEEN WORKING THIS SAME AREA FOR THE PAST FOUR DAYS AND WAS AWARE OF THE STEEPNESS OF THE GRADE. AFTER CLEANING UP THE LOCATION AT BLAINE THEY MOVED TO MP BAH-36.5. ONLY A PORTION OF THE RAIL AT THIS LOCATION WAS LOADED BECAUSE IT WAS STARTING TO SPRINKLE RAIN. AS THE PROGRESS RAIL TRUCK TRAVELED EAST, CARRYING 63 RAILS APPROXIMATELY 40 FEET IN LENGTH EACH, THEY CALLED OUT MP 35 AND EVERYTHING SEEMED OK. THE NEXT THING CSX FOREMAN HEARD WAS THE GRAPPLE TRUCK OPERATORS SAYING THAT THEY LOST CONTROL AND WERE SLIDING AND PICKING UP SPEED. CSX FOREMAN DOES NOT RECALL HEARING THEM REPORT BY MP 34. WHEN THE PROGRESS RAIL SUPERVISOR WHO WAS ON THE RAIL 2 MILES AHEAD OF THE LARGE TRUCK HEARD WHAT WAS HAPPENING HE GOT OFF THE RAIL AT MP BAH-29.8. HE WATCHED THE PROGRESS RAIL TRUCK GO BY. THE PROGRESS RAIL TRUCK TRAVELED 2130 FEET PAST THE CROSSING WHERE IT DERAILED AT MP 29.4 WENT 80 FEET OVER THE NORTH SIDE OF THE BRIDGE. BOTH PROGRESS RAIL EMPLOYEES HAD JUMPED OUT OF THE TRUCK PRIOR TO DERAILING RESULTING IN INJURIES

0811LK004-d-08-03-11-UP.Narrative: SHOP MOVERS WERE GIVEN INSTRUCTIONS BY THE SUPERVISOR TO TAKE THE UP9747 OVER TO NORTH 11 RAIL.  WHILE ENROUTE TO 11 RAIL A YARD CREW WAS BRINGING IN THE MCHPB-02 FOR SERVICING.  AS THE MCHPB-02 CREWPROCEEDED THROUGH THE SWITCH, A SHOP GROUND PERSON RADIOED TO THE SHOP MOVER TO STOP.  SHOP MOVER DID NOT RESPOND.  THE GROUND PERSON PROCEEDED TO USE HAND SIGNAL, BUT STILL NO RESPONSE.  BY THIS TIMEIT WAS TOO LATE TO STOP SO THE GROUND PERSON JUMPED FROM THE LOCOMOTIVE IN FEAR OF GETTING HURT.  UP9747 SIDESWIPED THE UP9522 AND UP9555 CAUSING DAMAGE.  F&O OPERATING THE EQUIPMENT HAD BECOME ILL DUE TO PERSONAL MEDICAL CONDITION AND OTHER LOCOMOTIVE MOVER WAS INJURED FROM JUMPING FROM THE UNIT.

717362-d-08-07-11-WC.Narrative: C70581-06 HAD FINISHED SPOTTING COAL LOADS ON THE LOOP TRACK AT WISCONSIN PUBLIC SERVICES WESTON COAL PLANT FACILITY. THEY THEN PROCEEDED WITH LIGHT ENGINES, UP 6826 & UP 7078, AROUND THE LOOP TRACK TO PICK UP THE DP POWER. WHEN THEY CAME AROUND THE CURVE BY THE DUMPER HOUSE LEAD, THE ENGINEER SAW THE WESTON POWER PLANT SWITCH ENGINE WITH HEADLIGHT ON DIM AND IN THE CLEAR. HE PROCEEDED WHEN HE NOTICED THAT THE SWITCH ENGINE WAS MOVING TOWARD HIM. THE ENGINEER PLACED THE UNITS INTO EMERGENCY ANDUNIT UP 6826 WAS SIDESWIPED BY THE UNMANNED UNIT LOX 8754. IT WAS FOUND THAT THE INDUSTRY HAD NOT SECURED THEIR EQUIPMENT WHICH ALLOWED THE UNIT AND 6 CARS TO ROLL OFF THE DUMP TRACK AND INTO THE SIDEON UP 6826 ON THE LOOP TRACK. NOTHING DERAILED AND THERE WAS NO TRACK DAMAGE.

HE WAS ABOUT TO GET OUT OF THE TRUCK AND STOP TRAFFIC WHEN AN OIL TRUCK ENTERED THE CROSSING WITHOUT PROPER AUTHORIZATION FROM THE TRAIN CREW.  A RAILCAR STRUCK THE OIL TRAILER BEFORE STOPPING.  CONDUCTOR IMPLEMENTEDPROPER PROCEDURE FOR PROTECTING THE CROSSING.  CONDUCTOR HAD FLASHERS ON AND WAS GETTING OUT OF COMPANY VEHICLE TO STOP THE TRUCK WHEN IT PROCEEDED THROUGH THE CROSSING.  ALL OIL TRUCKS ARE REQUIRED TO STOP AT ALL YARD CROSSINGS AND NOT PROCEED WHEN RAIL CARS ARE STOPPED NEXT TO A CROSSING UNLESS ATRAINMAN SPECIFIES IT IS CLEAR TO PROCEED ACROSS.

WHEN THE CONDUCTOR GOT TO THE END OF THE CUT, HE FOUND THAT TRACK #1 WAS IN THE FOUL OFTHE LEAD AND HAD RAKED 4 CARS IN THEIR TRAIN. FOUR HAZARDOUS CARS SUSTAINED DAMAGE: UCLX 3003, SHPX204974, GATX 62594 AND GATX 29720 WHEN SIDES WIPED BY CSXT 260650 THAT WAS FOULING THE TRACK. HE WALKED BY TILX 220183 WHICH WAS THE WEST CAR IN HA07 AND NOTICED THAT THE CAR WAS CLOSE TO THE LADDER TRACK BUT DID NOT MEASURE FOR CLEARANCE. ONCE HE LINED THE SWITCHING HA13, HE INSTRUCTED THE ENGINEER HE WAS CLEAR TO SHOVE 20 CARS TO A PICK UP. AS THE REAR CAR, NATX 20119, TRAVERSED OVER THE HA07 SWITCH, THE CONDUCTOR VIEW WAS BLOCKED BUT HE HEARD THE CAR RAKE TILX 220138 AND TOLD HIS ENGINEER TO STOP. WHEN THE TRAIN CAME TO A STOP, 4 CARS (NATX 20119, NATX 200102, TILX 201102 ANDNCLX 162) HAD IMPACTED TILX 220138. THERE WAS NO CARS DERAILED, LEAKS OR EXPOSURES DUE TO THE INCIDENT. CONDUCTOR WAS TESTED AND RESULTS WERE NEGATIVE.

D641611-d-08-16-11-LAS.Narrative:
TRAIN WAS PULLING 51 INBOUND CARS THROUGH THE CROSSOVER TO START YARDING THEIR TRAIN.  WHEN THE REAROF THE TRAIN CLEARED THE TRACK #5 SWITCH, THE CONDUCTOR TOLD THE ENGINEER "THAT'LL DO".  THE CONDUCTOR STATED THAT HE THEN HEARD A LOUD CRASH.  AS HE LOOKED UP THE TRAIN, HE SAW THAT THE CARS HAD DERAILED.  HE STATED THAT AS HE WALKED TOWARD THE DERAILMENT, HE SAW THAT 5 CARS HAD DERAILED AND THAT2 OF THEM WERE TURNED OVER AND 1 WAS TILTED.

M412111-d-08-08-11-BRS.Primary Accident Cause: Kicking or dropping cars, inadequate precautions
M412111-d-08-08-11-BRS.Accident Cause: Kicking or dropping cars, inadequate precautions
M412111-d-08-08-11-BRS.Narrative: JOB 310 PULLED THE OXBOW CUT THROUGH TRACK #11 WEST TO EAST CUTTING AWAY FROM TWO EMPTY CARS HOLDINGON TO FOUR EMPTIES. THEY SHOVED THE FOUR EMPTIES INTO #9 TRACK FROM THE EAST END. THEY LEFT THE FOUR CARS AT THE EAST END OF #9 TRACK TYING 3 HANDBRAKES ON 4 EMPTY CARS.  310 THEN RAN THOROUGH #10 TRACK BACK TO THE WEST END OF THE CENTRAL YARD.   ONE CONDUCTOR STAYED WITH THE POWER AND ASSUMED THERESPONSIBILITIES OF PULLING PINS.  OTHER CONDUCTORS REMAINED IN THE FIELD TYING BRAKES AND LINING SWITCHES. FIRST CONDUCTOR ASKED ON TWO OCCASIONS IF THEY WERE LINED FOR THE EAST YARD LEAD AND OTHER CONDUCTOR RESPONDED YES. THEY KICKED THREE LOADED PLASTIC CARS INTO #9 TRACK ON TOP OF 4 EMPTY COKE CARS WITH THREE HANDBRAKES APPLIED, WHICH THEN FAILED.  THE CARS IN #9 TRACK WERE ALLOWED TO ROLL FOUL OF THE EAST CENTRAL YARD LEAD. THE NEXT CARS KICK WERE DEAD PLASTICS DESTINED FOR THE EAST YARD LEAD. THE SWITCH PREVIOUSLY STATED AS BEING LINED FOR THE EAST YARD LEAD WAS IN FACT LINED FOR THE EAST CENTRAL YARD LEAD INSTEAD. THIS ALLOWED THE CARS TO SIDESWIPE THE CARS FOUL OF THE LEAD AT THE EAST END OF #9 TRACK.

I081911-d-08-19-11-PATH.Narrative:
AT 1947 HOURS, ON AUGUST 19, 2011, AN EIGHT-CAR TRAIN WAS BEING RELAYED ON E TRACK IN SOUTH STREET YARD.  IT WAS RAINING HEAVILY DURING THE TIME OF THIS MOVE.  THE ENGINEER/SWITCHMAN WAS OPERATING THETRAIN FROM LEAD CAR 5695.   AS THE TRAIN ENTERED E TRACK, THE ENGINEER/SWITCHMAN PLACED THE MASTERCONTROLLER INTO THE âFULL SERVICEâ POSITION.  WHEN HE REALIZED THAT THE TRAIN WAS NOT SLOWING DOWN,HE PLACED THE MASTER CONTROLLER INTO THE âEMERGENCYâ POSITION.  THE TRAIN CONTINUED TO MOVE, AND ITSTRUCK THE BUMPING BLOCK ON E TRACK.          

DAMAGES ASSOCIATED WITH THIS INCIDENT ARE: WAY & STRUCTURES- $13,800.00; CAR EQUIPMENT $21,817.20. THERE WERE NO INJURIES ASSOCIATED WITH THIS INCIDENT.  THIS INCIDENT MEETS THE CRITERIA IN 49CFR PART 225 AS A REPORTABLE ACCIDENT.

SYSTEM SAFETY AND ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT (SS&EM) HAS DETERMINED THAT THE SPIN-SLIDE FEATURE OF THE PA-5 CLASS CARBRAKING SYSTEM, AND THE BLENDING OF DYNAMIC AND FRICTION BRAKING AT LOW SPEEDS ARE A CAUSAL FACTOR IN THIS INCIDENT.  WET, SLIPPERY RAILS WERE ALSO A CONTRIBUTING FACTOR.  

THE SPIN-SLIDE CONTROL BEHAVIOR BRAKING SYSTEM FUNCTION OF THE CARS ARE PRESENTLY BEING TESTED BY CAR MANUFACTURER KAWASAKIRAIL CAR, AND PROPULSION MANUFACTURER SIEMENS.  SIEMENS HAS DEVELOPED OF A NEW PROPULSION SOFTWARE WHICH WILL ADDRESS THE ISSUE.
